title: Police: Missing Gary teen might be in 'extreme danger' | Chicago Sun-Times
text:
Police: Missing Gary teen might be in ‘extreme danger’ 
Chastinea Reeves | Gary police @FCGattuso | Sign-Up for our News & Politics Newsletter Sign-Up 
Authorities have issued an Amber Alert for a 15-year-old girl who went missing early Monday from Gary, Indiana, and might be in “extreme danger,” police said. Chastinea Reeves | Indiana State Police 
Chastinea Reeves disappeared around 2 a.m. from the area of 2027 Maine St., according to Gary police. 
She is described as a 5-foot-2, 130-pound black girl with black hair and brown eyes, police said. She was last seen wearing a gray shirt and light-colored jeans. 
“It is urgent we locate Chastinea and assure she is safe from harm,” Gary Police Lt. Dawn Westerfield said. 
Anyone with information should call detectives at (219) 755-3855 or dial 911. Previously from Chicago News
